description: On startup it shows a black screen and then hangs, tried resizing window then crashes.
summary: Hangs on start and can crash

description: Selecting a crop and clicking "done" doesn't do anything.
This never worked for a years now! Is so bad!

Did exactly what I expected (grab image files from internal drives and collate them) It might be nice to have an interface which allows user to define which locations it initially scans. GUI is fast and efficient (Debian 12.5)

Well, it's kinda gnomish: The app looks nice but is way too meagre when it comes to features, even necessary ones. So it automatically grabs everything – not only photographs stored in the folder Pictures, but also book covers from the Calibre Library, logos from everywhere on my disk, PDFs from the Download folder and so on. Now, after one hour searching for a way to reduce this mess and give the program access just to the folder Pictures, I give up. Back to Shotwell!
Better than many apps available to GNOME.

The search engine could take a major overhaul, even more when you think about Google Photos. Can't search for date, time, camera, or localization. This makes album creation imperative, and it's not everyone that takes time to do it. Better edition options would be great also.

The general look and feel of the app is great, and it's very simples to use. Looking forward for new versions.
I use Eye of GNOME and gThumb, I followed GNOME Photos since its beginnings and still can't figure out what purpose it is serving.
Gnome Photo 3.24 always crash on my system. Just opened and crash!
Does it's job really good.

The app does does not seem to be able to properly detect albums, with only my Screenshots album being detected for whatever reason despite giving it over 24 hours to index photos. It also misses out on a lot of functionality such as being able to zoom in on features or touch gestures. Not recommended at all.
I organized my Photos into albums, moved to another SSD, than realized that Albums are lost. I didn't found a way to move albums to another storage device.
I like the simplicity of the app but it feels a little slow when editing a photo, especial when one considers how responsive editing a photo on a phone is.
summary: its nice and simple but a little sluggish when editing photos

description: Would love to know if it is color managed.  Does GTK3 automatically apply the icc profile based on the monitor Gnome Photos is on?

This will only look to the main 'Pictures' folder. 
If you choose to have any other type of file structure, it will not access the photos on your main hard drive
Seems to be the only image/viewer editor to adopt this approach and seems a strange default app to have in Fedora.
summary: Will not support customised file systems

description: What is the point of this app? It's not to help me organise my photos. It's basically like searching for *.jpg in Files. Why?

Search is useless unless you specifically edit every name of your 500+photos first, cannot change thumbnail size. Would like to see on device software built in which detects whats in the photos and catergories everything by people,objects,pleaces etc (like google/apple photos). But otherwise its a nice basic photo viewer.
summary: Simple and Clean but needs more

description: I think this program has potential. But as of right now it just grabs random files that I don't want added. It needs more features

It awesome from the sleek interface to an awesome experience.
But pleeeeaaaase remove the DARK mode... some of us prefer consistency design rules.
Really loved it.
By default it shows larger thumbnail views when opening multiple files. Fast too.

It looks good, but needs the ability to pick a different pictures folder on the computer. I keep all of my documents in a folder that is synced with OneDrive but the app will only look at the Pictures folder in my home directory. That makes it completely useless for me.
I logged into 2 online accounts and had a jpg in my picture folder. The app just displayed no pictures in either place.
summary: Opened but did not find photos with 18.04.3

description: This app can't find any photos on my computer (either main drive or mounted disks). Can't use it!!
shows all my photos in one place, has great ui, and most option ill want in a photo manager. Just that it can't be set as the default image viewer and replace eye of gnome.
cannot import photo from external disk

description: It wont allow me to put photos on to it.

Photos from your Google photos account won't show up in here. This would be better if it connected with actual photo storage clouds rather than facebook (where you push some photos and forget about them).

Design and intention are top notch. However it is no where near the competitors in terms of features. The way it works right now it is merly a sketch of a program. Missing features are:

- Tags
- Rating system
- Face recognition
- Search Filters
.....

The program supports no kind of workflow that handles more than 1000 images.
not good at all, I prefer shotwell over this.

Bugs:

Creates duplicated entries for the same file with the same inode on the same mount, ie cd ~/Desktop; ln -s Pictures ../Pictures. Deleting a dupe then deletes both - that's worse than just a papercut.

Doesn't even list the online services which have been subscribed in Gnome Accounts. Only shows my external backup device, which is going to just generate even more duplicates in the list.

Did I mention that it shows duplicates? It's not rocket science to generate an md5sum of the file at the same time you're generating a thumbnail folks.
It has almost no features
This is sucks!
thks 4 great app, keep making our lives better

how to even add a folders from drives?????? its shows ,but cannot add any folder,tried in fedora gnome,and opensuse gnome with same results,nothing happened. so ,for me ,completely useless app.uninstalled.
i cant path my pictures from another hard disk

it's not ditecting any of my folders and showing that there is no photos
Worst piece of software I've used in a while. Unintuitive, very little worked correctly.

I don't understand the GNOME obsession with eliminating every useful part of an app. Everything GNOME makes is so 'simple' that I end up using something else. Simple != feature removal. Even the desktop is this way. I end up adding plugins to make even that work. I'm growing tired of it after years of GNOME use.

description: Much better than alternatives.
Should be simple. Show my pictures on my picture folder. It does not.
It just cant be used as an image viewer to open files with and right now the UI is completely borked.

This program shows only photos which are exactly in ~/Pictures directory. But why not include subdirs? All my photos are in different folders sorted by years and other criteria. This program may be good, but it's useless for me and users like me.
This apps top bar does not scale.
Only pictures in the top-level are shown...

No way to actually find anything - does NOT let you select any folders, does NOT show you where anything is, does NOW show names or dates, has NO WAY to sort anything, has NO help, no settings. Absolute time-wasting stupidity of an app. Beyond embarasing that this is a featured app in the store!
there is no way to see metadata, no way to add folders to the collection... skip this
There's not much to say because there are no features to speak about. It shows pictues in ~/Pictures. That's it. You can't even change the folder. Pathetic.

description: Para una app mas funcional, podrian agregar estas tres funciones, en el apartado de album seria bueno que aparezcan las carpetas que contienen fotos dentro de la carpeta imagenes; desde la misma app que se pueda copiar las imagenes como por ejemplo para pegarla dentro de libreoffice, similar a que si estuvieses copiando la imagen desde la app de archivos; y la ultima que las fotos esten divididas por la fechas similar a como se usa en google photos

no vim bindings, very slow to view big and many amounts of images for some reason. No custom key bindings. 
For an average person or a newbie this might be sufficient, but the +-1 second loads on some images is unbarable for me.

Using vimiv and vim bindings i can blast through my pictures and run scripts to move or etc..

description: Just a viewer. It can integrate well with google photos, though I rarely upload to it
summary: Very bland, no form of organization

description: This project is dead, I recommend finding a replacement if you can.

I have lots of photos. It doesn't find them. I searched online and got nowhere. Some said look in settings » search. That seems ok, the folder with my photos in it is there. This has been a problem for as long as I can remember. Such a foot-gun.
nice minimalistic gnome app. i like it.
I was unable to add any of my folders with images. The software can see the default Pictures folder, but nothing else. No custom folders can be added. Software is nearly useless.
Died at start. This app is preinstalled? Why ? Please remove from store until usuable. thank you
I liked it when it was the the gnome 44 version on fedora 39, but since I upgraded to fedora 39 it doesn't show anything.

Loading a bigger library takes ages. Navigating a library is not possible. It cannot be set as default image viewer. Really not a masterpiece lacking a ton of features, performance and the UX is a desaster.

Other tools like gthumb or shotweel can do more, faster and more reliable.

I'm guessing this is supposed to be an easy to use image viewer for the Gnome Desktop, but it will not let me see photos in various folders and only shows some in my photos folder. This is quite a buggy and unfinished product. I will be using gThumb which is more intuitive and has the features of a basic image viewer.
For the flatpak version btw. Also cannot search online photos from google
summary: Cannot use it as default viewer

description: Use gThumb or better yet digiKam. This app is dumb. Minimalist things are not always better.
Everything I would need from a photo app: looking at them, organize them, copping them and small adjustments.
Doesn't seem to have the import functionality
hab ich schon länger gesucht, so mag ich das

Es ist unmöglich, Fotos zu finden, weil keine Ordner durchsucht werden können. Man kann nur einen Suchbegriff eingeben, aber es haben ja nicht alle Dokumente Beschreibungen in Metadaten. Keine Suche nach Ort, Pfad, Aufnahmedatum. Als Photo-Management-Tool völlig nutzlos. Seit Jahren keine Funktionalität hinzugekommen.

GNOME Fotos könnte eine richtig gute Bilderverwaltung sein, wenn es nur wollte. Allerdings fehlen einige wichtige Funktionen, die mir persönlich sehr wichtig wären. So sind die Bilder in der Übersicht nicht sinnvoll sortiert. Mir würden »Zwischenüberschriften« mit dem jeweiligen Datum oder Monat sehr gefallen. Zwar lassen sich Bilder in selbst erstellten Sammlungen sortieren, doch das Hinzufügen gestaltet sich des öfteren eher als schwierig. Für mich quasi unverzichtbar (und längst Standard auf anderen Plattformen) ist die Sortierung der Bilder nach Orten oder Gesichtern. Beides bietet GNOME Fotos derzeit leider noch nicht.

Als Alternativen würde ich entweder das gut in den GNOME-Desktop integrierte gThumb empfehlen oder für eine Fotoverwaltung mit Gesichtserkennung die Linuxversion von Picasa.
Leider gelingt es nicht den Bildschirm zu fotografieren. Daher gibt es auch keinen Stern. Offenbar muss man doch einen Stern anklicken, damit die Bewertung veröffentlicht wird.
Absolutely useless
zugriff ist auf den Bilderordner und onlinekonten beschränkt - was für ein blödsinn! nicht zu gebrauchen - schade um die Zeit
Zeigt alle Bilder in einer Liste an. Bei mir sind das mehr als 20000. Die kann/muss ich jetzt manuell gruppieren damit ich sie nach Jahren oder so aufteilen kann. Shotwell ist da deutlich besser.

This application has no real use. It only lists images found by tracker. You can't manually add images, neither local nor remote (apart from images in the cloud, woaw). Image eding features are also limited to basic functionality. The only thing I can do with it is uninstall.
Nur Bilder sichtbar, die dem Programm gefallen.
nautilus is better than this tool

Es findet fast keine Fotos
Dateinunterstützung aus dem Jahr 1999
Absoluter Müll, wie kann das sein das die Gnome.org so etwas integriert in eine Version 40
Komplett sinnlos
Das Programm ist sehr einfach und schlicht gehalten, aber man kann die Quellen nicht gescheit auswählen, das finde ich schade.
summary: Schön einfach, aber nur beschränkte Ordner

description: I'm using Google Fotos. So I connected to Gmail and also checked the Fotos option. But this app does not show any fotos and the online accounts option also does not work. So I'm going to uninstall ...
summary: does not work as expected for me

description: Findet gar nichts weder bilder noch sonstiges und Google Fotos auch nicht also was soll die App machen... Damit man Deinstallieren Üben kann?

Shows images which have been removed long ago or moved to a different location as broken "faild to load". Which doesn't surprises me much but also it does not seem to recognize this and keeps the images in the gallery. Which in return makes it a little unpleasant to look at if there are rows of placeholders.

Also does not properly show/import newly added images and there is no way to force it to re-import images from the directory it has access too.

No way to search for images by date or any image metadata such as locations, camera, resolution etc. Which is funny because it can show all these metadata of an image if you go to the image properties.

Adding pictures to a new album to get at lest some level of organization requires unnecessary many clicks.
1. Select the image
2. Click on “Add to Album”
2.1 Crete a new album
3. Select the album
4. Click ok.

It would be much easier to just right click the image and get a menu to show all available albums to add it by a single click instead of selecting the image and spawning new buttons far away from the mouse pointer. This would ease the process if you want to add an image to just one album instead of multiple at once.

Other than that the app is actually pretty nice and clean. A little too clean see above.
summary: Dose not work right and lacks essential features

description: Eine App, die nichts anzeigt… Wieso habe ich das bloss installiert?
De repente no abre o se cierra.
I would wich to have support for direct importation from a smartphone conected by USB. Currently we only can import photos from media devices, like USB-Flash and SD-Cards.

La aplicación es buena en sí, me recuerda mucho a la aplicación de Apple para sus fotos, sin embargo, la interfáz es un poco lenta en cuanto a la carga de fotos y, me hubiera encantado que mis fotos aparecieran por carpetas, tal y como las tengo yo guardadas en mi disco duro porque ¿para qué organizo mis fotografías en dos lugares?

Esta aplicación está bien para aquellos que no utilicen un gran número de archivos de imágenes. En eso la aplicación cumple con sus funciones básicas. Pero si nos gusta la fotografía y tenemos un gran número de imágenes, la organización de archivos con esta aplicación se hace tediosa y lenta.
summary: Aplicación poco eficaz aunque cumple con su cometido básico

description: a pesar de tener configurado varias cuentas no muestra fotos, ni siquiera las locales

L'applicaiton nous montre toutes les photos dans une seule liste, mais seulement quelques unes à la fois. Il faut descendre la fenêtre et attendre un bon moment pour voir les quelques prochaines, et ainsi de suite. Ça prends une éternité pour y voir les plus vieilles (plusieurs minutes). Et l'application de garde pas de cache. Il faut refaire le processus à chaque fois. Donc inutile comme gestionnaire de photos. En ce qui concerne l'édition, vraiment limité, donc inutile pour cela aussi. Il ne peut pas être employé non plus comme visionneur de photos, puisque ne peut pas ouvrir de photos du gestionnaire de fichiers.  Donc je ne comprends pas pourquoi quelque'un utiliserait cela. Ou plutôt, je comprends parfaitement pourquoi personne ne l'utilise.

Photos est un logiciel ergonomique, agréable pour obtenir une vue globale sur l'ensemble des images présentes sur l'ordinateur. Toutefois il manque des configurations basiques plus que nécessaires comme le choix des dossiers à répertorier (ou à ignorer) et l'édition des photos est vraiment basique (pour un logiciel aussi léger ce n'est pas étonnant).
Résumé, un logiciel sympa mais trop simple.
Très lent si beaucoup de photos, notamment depuis le nuage.

L'application est fonctionnelle mais il manque de nombreuses options.
- Choix des dossiers à afficher.
- Plus d'options de retouche.
- Plus de choix de partage.
- Pouvoir classer et modifier les informations des photos.
Bref il y a du travail !!

Mais qu'est ce que c'est que çà  ? Personne n'utilise des tablettes avec Gnome alors pourquoi nous pondre une appli pensée pour tablette qui affiche indistinctement TOUTES les photos de la machine tout en demandant de scroller...

L'ergonomie pour créer un album est loin d'être évidente (ne me faites pas croire que çà a été testé sur qui que çà soit) et ... l'appli crash, évidemment.
Genre, souvent..

et pas de cache, donc l'appli rescanne à CHAQUE LANCEMENT les photos. 

Les albums crées ne sont pas exportable dans un fichier 'base de donnée' pour être restauré après installation.. bref, ne l'installez pas.
Très propre, comme toujours avec le projet Gnome, mais son absence de fonctionnalités en fait une application pas plus puissante qu'un simple visionneur d'images
summary: Très propre, mais manque cruellement de fonctionnalités

description: pas assez complet notamment c'est le dossier image et c'est tout. Mes photos sont dans des dossiers sur un NAS, ce programme ne permet pas de les afficher, peut être parcequ'elles sont dans des dossiers et des sous dossiers.... Dommage car l'idée d'un navigateur simple est attrayante.
Manque de fonctions basiques (rotation, redimensionnement) et navigation pénible (on ne trouve pas toutes les photos aisément)
Application qui n'a rien de plus que les utilitaires couramment installés

l'application scanne le disque local uniquement et dans sa totalité.
mon besoin est de définir moi-même quel dossier scanner et notamment un disque réseau.
logique absurbe , à moins de passer des heures à tenter de comprendre
ne trouve qu une seule image

Comme dit dans le reste des avis, cette application est trop simpliste et manque de paramètres et fonctionnalités essentiels tel que de pouvoir visualiser des photos stockées ailleurs que dans le dossier Images. Il semblerait que cela soit possible au sein de l'application Paramètres, section Recherche puis bouton Emplacements de recherche, cependant cela ne semble pas fonctionner pour moi. L'impossibilité d'ouvrir des images depuis le gestionnaire de fichiers, de pouvoir tourner des images, ou encore sauvegarder ses albums sont également des manques assez importants. Cela est dommage, car on ne peut profiter de l'interface moderne et des fonctionnalités originales telles que l'affichage sur téléviseur ou la gestion des photos sur Google Photos et Facebook (ceci étant dit, peut-être qu'il s'agit d'un besoin que pourra pleinement satisfaire cette app)

ALTERNATIVE : Si vous souhaitez un visionneur/éditeur d'images simple, bien intégré à GNOME et comprenant les fonctions basiques attendues, je vous conseille vivement d'essayer gThumb.
Il faut retirer cette application de toute urgence
summary: Plante dés la sélection d'un nouveau dossier

description: Je me demande pourquoi cette application est encore développé.
интерфейс настолько упрощен, что большинство функций не работает. добавить в поиск сетевые диски не представляется возможным.

Не никакой возможности открыть фото на дисках. Ну просто никак. При установке увидел в папке Изображения 3 (ТРИ!) фотографии и после никак ничего не видит. Добавлял фото в папку, прописывал в строке поиска адрес где лежат фото - не реагирует. Попробовал откадрировать фото - не получается. Может только удалять фото. Хотя по сути нужна такая простенькая программа для первичной обработки фото: Посмотреть, удалить не нужные, обрезать, сделать минимальные изменения в целях улучшения. Нужно дорабатывать программу.
автоматически не группирует фотографии по датам, просто всё в одну кучу
нужно добавить импорт с сетевых дисков. 92гб фото программа почему-то не видит, точнее видит 10 фото из всей папки изображения. это странно. shotwell с этой задачей справляется лучше
Не отображает фото в галерее. Из 30 фото в превью только 5 от силы
不过者功能也太简单了吧，不如把shotwell 弄到gnome来改造改造
和gnome的风格比较统一，不过功能太简单了，且不能作为默认的图片打开软件
Fedora原先预装的照片管理软件是shotwell，为什么要换成这个软件？这个软件功能不行，最后还得换用别的。

too simple application, make it complex to done normal operation like cropping images
Actually, I think it's okay. We need to continue working hard. It's a pity not to update it
